original: gzhan dag na re de dag gis ni sgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag gis ni sgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan la /
translated: Others say: They do not teach the stages of realization at all because they do not teach the order of meditation and so on.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i don yang ji ltar bshad par bya zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i don yang ji ltar bshad par bya zhes zer ro //

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin la /

original: de dang 'gal ba yang bdag med pa goms pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang bdag med pa goms pa yin te /
translated: And that is incompatible with cultivating the view of selflessness.

original: de bas na de med par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de med par sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on occur in the absence of that view?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag med pa ston pa lhur byed pa rnams pa bcu drug po 'di dag thams cad gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba la phan pa skyed par bzhed pa nyid kyis de ltar ji skad du gsungs pa'i tshul rnam
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag med pa ston pa lhur byed pa rnams pa bcu drug po 'di dag thams cad gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba la phan pa skyed par bzhed pa nyid kyis de ltar ji skad du gsungs pa'i tshul rnam
translated: Because all sixteen aspects that emphasize the teaching of selflessness in the way just explained are taught in various ways by the wish to benefit those disciples who are close to the Buddha.

original: pa sna tshogs kyis bstan pa yin du zin kyang yang dag par goms par gyur pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam skyed par 'gyur ba yin no zhes nges par bya ste gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o
analyzed: pa sna tshogs kyis bstan pa yin du zin kyang yang dag par goms par gyur pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam skyed par 'gyur ba yin no zhes nges par bya ste gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o
translated: Even though they are taught in that way, when one becomes fully familiar with them, the path of seeing is generated by the reality of dependent origination. One should ascertain this and understand the other aspects in the same way.

original: // mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ba yin pa las brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang gdul bya 'bras bu la gzhol ba nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir re zhig bsgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa bstan pa ni /

translated: The path of meditation should be explained immediately after the path of seeing, but because there is little to be said and because disciples who are inclined to the result enter it, the function of the path of meditation is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //

original: yongs su dul ba'i slad du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad rang dbang du byed pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad dul ba'i don gyis na /

translated: The meaning of complete self-discipline is to face the sign of complete self-discipline, which is the first function of self-discipline.

analyzed: ba ni gnyis pa 'dud pa'i byed pa'o //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba gsum pa nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba'i byed pa bstan pa'i phyir koo shi ka gzhan yang shes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, when someone takes up this perfection of wisdom, etc.‚Äù

translated: The three verses on entering the battle, etc., should be explained as the realization of the two sets of three types of adverse factors, the great of the middling, etc., in accordance with their number, and the two aspects of the factors of virtue, the middling of the small, etc.

original: g-yul gyi nang du 'gro ba'am zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu'i chen po gnyen po'i gnyen po'i phyogs chen po'i chung du thob pas so //

translated: Entering the battle, etc., means that by attaining the small of the great of the adverse factors, the great of the small of the factors of virtue, one enters the battle.

original: 'greng ngam zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu'i 'bring la gnyen po'i phyogs chen po'i 'bring mngon par rtogs pas g-yul du 'breng ba'o //üîΩ'dug kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni g-yul du 'dug ste /

original: 'di dag thams cad kyis kyang mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs rnam pa dgu po bsal ba dang bla bas bsgom pa'i lam du slar yang bya ba med pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni mi srid pa'o //

translated: In the same way, how can the yogis who are concentrated on the mere extensive [teachings] be concentrated on all the meanings included in them? For this reason, the extensive explanation is taught.

analyzed: de ltar don 'dis bstan pa'i tshig gis ston to zhes bshad de /

original: mthong ba'i dgos pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ci'i phyir gzung snyam du 'ga' zhig rtog pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /

translated: distinguish the world with the ten virtues and so forth through skill in wisdom and means. Therefore, it is the unequaled knowledge-mantra because it is unequalled.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos nub pa na rgyal ba'i yum gyi mthu stobs kyis 'jig rten du chos spyod pa la sogs pa 'jug pas na mnyam pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lhan cig mnyam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang
translated: When the true Dharma of the Tathagatas has disappeared, the power of the Mother of the Victor, the perfection of wisdom, causes the practice of Dharma and so on to be engaged in the world.

analyzed: rab tu 'byed do zhes bya ba ni rab tu shes pa'o //

translated: Otherwise, when, immediately after the apprehension of a pot, there is the apprehension of a cloth, the mere immediate antecedent of that would be delimited as the cause, and the two would be the entities of cause and effect.

original: / rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis rang rig pa la ni sngon dang phyi mar gyur pa'i dngos po 'brel par snang ba'i 'dzin pa yang yod pa ma yin no //

original: de bas na 'di'i rjes thogs la 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i yongs su gcod pa med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par rig @128a * //üîΩpa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i rjes thogs la 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i yongs su gcod pa med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges par rig @128a * // pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no delimitation of the sort ‚ÄúThis arises immediately after that,‚Äù it is not ascertained as the entity of cause and effect.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i rjes la 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: kye dge slong dag mtshan dang dpe byad kyis 'bar pa 'di la ni sku dam pa yang dag pa'i sku rdul phra rab bsags pa'i rang bzhin bden pa nyid du ma 'dzin par zhes bya bas na sgrub par bya ba'i chos gsungs pa yin no //

translated: O monks, do not grasp at this blazing body, which is endowed with the major and minor marks, as being the true body, which is composed of subtle particles.

original: dge slong dag nga ni chos kyi skus yongs su rdzogs par te /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga ni chos kyi skus yongs su rdzogs par te /

translated: Look at me as being complete in the body of truth, which is the result of the practice of the nondual knowledge that is like an illusion. This is the reason.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'di ni yang dag pa'i mthas rab tu phye ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'di yang ji skad du brjod pa'i ye shes sgom pa'i sgrub par byed pas yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin no zhes rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs rjod pa yin no //

original: don ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin pas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la sogs pas gzung bar mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rig pa'i mngon sum du grub ste //

translated: Since the meaning is extremely hidden, it cannot be apprehended by a cognition that has aspects and so forth. Therefore, it is established by the direct perception of the awareness of nondual wisdom.

analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar don gyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur bar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //

original: gang gi phyir ji srid dngos po la mngon par zhen pas shes bya la shes pa kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de srid du de ma yin la der 'dzin pas shes pa 'khrul pa de kho na mthong ba las thag ring ba yin no //

analyzed: bu'i rang bzhin yin pa bsgribs shing ma rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer bas yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma rtogs na mngon par 'dod pa'i don las nyams pas chud zos par gyur na mi rung ba de bas na de bstan @135a * //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúSince in the future the counterfeit perfection of wisdom will appear due to the meaning of similarity, therefore, having heard that, the bodhisattva who is intent on the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment will, if he does not realize the authentic perfection of wisdom, be deprived of the desired goal.

original: par bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: par bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It would not be right for him to be ruined, so it is taught.

original: gang gis de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin spangs pas spong bar 'gyur ba de rgyu dang rang bzhin ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin spangs pas spong bar 'gyur ba de rgyu dang rang bzhin ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes gsol ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By what kind of cause and nature is it that one abandons it by abandoning its cause and nature? The request is Bhagavan, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: The reflection of the perfection of wisdom is explained by the master Dignaga:

original: skabs kyi don dang mi mthun pas //
analyzed: skabs kyi don dang mi mthun pas //
translated: Since it is not in accord with the meaning of the passage,

original: gang yang don gzhan la rtog pa //
analyzed: gang yang don gzhan la rtog pa //
translated: Whatever is imagined to have another meaning,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin smra ba //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin smra ba //
translated: That is said to be the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o // zhes bshad do //
translated: That is called a reflection.

original: dge slong kha cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po pa kho na las rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po pa kho na las rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Some monks means only those of the Mahayana who are said to be proponents of mere consciousness.

original: lus ma goms pas zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du goms par ma byas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yul dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyis na lus ma bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: lus ma goms pas zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du goms par ma byas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yul dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyis na lus ma bsgoms pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot cultivating the body‚Äù means that the six collections of consciousness, which have not been cultivated in the absence of intrinsic nature due to being devoid of the nature of one and many, are not cultivated in the body due to having the nature of the six collections of consciousness and their objects.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says ‚Äúnot cultivating morality,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig 'di gsum gyis go rims bzhin du lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum dang bral ba nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'di gsum gyis go rims bzhin du lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum dang bral ba nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These three phrases state the absence of the three trainings in superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom, respectively.

original: de dag gis don nges par bya ba'i phyir dang / shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis don nges par bya ba'i phyir dang / shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to ascertain the meaning of those, he says ‚Äúhaving bad wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mi shes pa dang ldan pas shes rab 'chal pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi shes pa dang ldan pas shes rab 'chal pa'o //
translated: Because of possessing ignorance, there is bad wisdom.

original: som nyi'i shes rab can yin pas lug ltar lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: som nyi'i shes rab can yin pas lug ltar lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: He is a person of the wisdom of doubt, and so is by nature dumb as a sheep.

original: log pa'i shes pas shes rab yongs su mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas shes rab yongs su mnyam pa'o //
translated: He is a person of the wisdom of error, and so is completely ignorant.üîΩThe destruction of form is the impermanence of form.

original: gzugs 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs med pa'i 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do //üîΩrnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma phan chad mi gnas pa'i 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs med pa'i 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do // rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma phan chad mi gnas pa'i 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The destruction of the imagined form is the impermanence of form.

original: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs kyi kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang bral ba nyid kyi 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs kyi kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang bral ba nyid kyi 'jig pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: The destruction of the form of the imagined nature, which is the reality nature of form, is the impermanence of form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes nye bar ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes nye bar ston to //
translated: He teaches that the perfection of wisdom is the impermanence of form.

original: don @135b gsum po 'di dag ni zlos pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don @135b gsum po 'di dag ni zlos pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: These three meanings should be seen in the manner of a reductio.

original: log pa'i shes pa bcom pa ni nyid kyis bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid stod par byed do zhes gsungs pa ni 'di skad du gang de ltar ston pa dang de ltar tshol ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'gyur te zhes
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa bcom pa ni nyid kyis bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid stod par byed do zhes gsungs pa ni 'di skad du gang de ltar ston pa dang de ltar tshol ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par 'gyur te zhes
translated: The destruction of false knowledge is the self-praise of the self by the self.

original: kyang nye bar ston to zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'ji skad du smras pa'i bshad pa ni chos dang chos can rnam par ma gsal bas phyin ci log tu dngos po la mngon par zhen pas grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas yang koo shi ka gzugs 'jig pa gzugs mi rtag
analyzed: kyang nye bar ston to zhes bya ba'o // 'ji skad du smras pa'i bshad pa ni chos dang chos can rnam par ma gsal bas phyin ci log tu dngos po la mngon par zhen pas grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas yang koo shi ka gzugs 'jig pa gzugs mi rtag
translated: This is also taught: ‚ÄúWhoever teaches like this and seeks like this will practice the perfection of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩThe explanation of what was said is that one will not be liberated by wrongly adhering to things because of not clarifying the dharma and dharmin.

original: pa nyid du mi blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa nyid du mi blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With this intention, it is said, ‚ÄúKau≈õika, do not view the impermanence of form as the destruction of form.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: However, the perfection of wisdom is the knowledge that form and so on have the nature of illusions.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: It is rooted in the mistaken belief in things and nonthings.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par yang dag par spong ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya par dgongs so //üîΩbkur pa tsam dgu pa ni gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ji srid du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par yang dag par spong ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi go 'phang thob par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya par dgongs so // bkur pa tsam dgu pa ni gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ji srid du gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de
translated: The object to be accomplished is the attainment of the stage of the Tathagata, because it is the cause for completely abandoning the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience, together with their traces, which are rooted in the mistaken adherence to things as real, as non-existent, and so forth.

original: dag thams cad rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed pa la bsod nams mang du skyed pa nyid du bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dag thams cad rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed pa la bsod nams mang du skyed pa nyid du bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The ninth praise is stated by the teaching that the generation of merit is greater when one establishes all sentient beings in the world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, beginning with the Jambudvipa, in the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gzhag pa yin la /
translated: And those who establish them in the result of stream-enterer establish them in the uncontaminated realm.

original: mngon par dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam sbyin pa dang de yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon par dad pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam sbyin pa dang de yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't the gift of the perfection of wisdom book, and the teaching of it, etc., preceded by faith, etc., contaminated?

original: ji ltar na don byed pa snga ma bas phyi ma bsod nams mang po skyed pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na don byed pa snga ma bas phyi ma bsod nams mang po skyed pa yin snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: How can the later one generate much more merit than the earlier one, which is for the sake of sentient beings?üîΩThe doubts are anticipated with Why is that?

original: koo shi ka 'di las rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rab tu byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di las rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rab tu byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and then it is said, Kausika, from this the result of stream-enterer is well-performed.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rgya che zhing dri ma med la mtha' yas pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs @136a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rgya che zhing dri ma med la mtha' yas pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs @136a * //
translated: This is saying that the Tathagata, etc., have a great, stainless, infinite collection of good qualities.

original: pa 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu ni rgyal ba'i yum nyid yin pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las 'byung ba ni shin tu yang gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di'i glegs bam byin pa la sogs pa
analyzed: pa 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu ni rgyal ba'i yum nyid yin pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las 'byung ba ni shin tu yang gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di'i glegs bam byin pa la sogs pa
translated: Therefore, giving the volume of the perfection of wisdom and so on

original: ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang gzhan mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir bsod nams ches mang pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no
analyzed: ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang gzhan mchog tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir bsod nams ches mang pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no
translated: is a cause that is free of defects. Hence it is said that it is a great source of merit because it gives rise to the result of stream enterer and other states that are supreme and special, such as buddhahood.

original: // bsngags pa tsam dang po ni gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: // bsngags pa tsam dang po ni gzhan yang koo shi ka rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: The first praise: Moreover, Kausika, if a son or daughter of good lineage were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvipa who have gone to the result of once returner and so on.

original: gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin no //
translated: So it is said.

original: snga ma bzhin de'i phyir zhe na zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du lan thob pa ni koo shi ka 'di las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin de'i phyir zhe na zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du lan thob pa ni koo shi ka 'di las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The response to the question ‚ÄúWhy is it so?‚Äù is understood in the same way as before.

analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad phyir mi 'ongs ba'i 'bras bu la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The second is from ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, if all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa were established in the fruit of non-returner‚Äù and so forth.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dgongs pa nyid kyis de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtogs pa la /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dgongs pa nyid kyis de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rtogs pa la /
translated: The response to the question ‚ÄúWhy is it so?‚Äù is understood by the intention explained above.

original: de bzhin du lan btab pa la koo shi ka 'di las phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan btab pa la koo shi ka 'di las phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The response is like before, from ‚ÄúKau≈õika, it is because of this that the fruit of non-returner‚Äù and so forth.

original: gsum pa ni gzhan yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la zhig gis dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gzhan yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la zhig gis dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The third is also stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the state of an arhat.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du smras pa'i rnam pas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dgongs pa la snga ma bzhin du koo shi ka 'di las dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du smras pa'i rnam pas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dgongs pa la snga ma bzhin du koo shi ka 'di las dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the sense stated here, why is that? The intention is as before. The passage beginning with ‚ÄúKau≈õika, from this, the state of an arhat‚Äù is stated.

original: bzhi ba ni gzhan yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis rang sangs rgyas nyid la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ba ni gzhan yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis rang sangs rgyas nyid la bkod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is also stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the state of a pratyekabuddha.‚Äù

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dgongs pa la de bzhin du koo shi ka rang sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @136b pa yin no //üîΩlnga pa ni yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i tshul du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dgongs pa la de bzhin du koo shi ka rang sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @136b pa yin no // lnga pa ni yang koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: In the manner expressed, Why is that? is the intention. Accordingly, Kausika, the state of a pratyekabuddha and so on is stated.

original: pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is also stated in the passage beginning with, Kausika, if some son of good lineage or daughter of good lineage caused all the sentient beings of Jambudvipa to generate the thought of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: nye bar gtad na zhes bya ba ni byin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gtad na zhes bya ba ni byin pa'o //
translated: Entrusting means giving.

original: bsam pa gang gis shen shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis shen shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: By what intention? This perfection of wisdom and so on is stated.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyis 'phel pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis rgyas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par gyi lam gyis spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyis 'phel pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis rgyas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par gyi lam gyis spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is cultivated by the path of preparation, it is increased by the path of seeing, it is expanded by the path of meditative development, and it is eliminated by the bodhisattva's special path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is fulfilled by the fulfilment of the Buddha-dharmas.

original: don gyi dbye bas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi dbye bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is taught in terms of the classification of the object.

original: snga ma de pas zhes bya ba ni gang la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa dang gang gzhan byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug nas glegs bam sbyin par byed pa'i gang zag de gnyis las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma de pas zhes bya ba ni gang la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa dang gang gzhan byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug nas glegs bam sbyin par byed pa'i gang zag de gnyis las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The former is superior to the latter. The former refers to the person who causes another to generate the thought of enlightenment, and the latter refers to the person who causes another to generate the thought of enlightenment and then gives him the scripture.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa sngon du 'gro bas glegs bam sbyin par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa sngon du 'gro bas glegs bam sbyin par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the giving of the scripture is preceded by the generation of the thought of enlightenment?

original: glegs bam 'ba' zhig sbyin par byed pa ji ltar bsod nams che ba yin snyam nas /

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rim gyis sgrib pa thams cad spong par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus paüîΩni thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rim gyis sgrib pa thams cad spong par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is the transcendent wisdom that gradually eliminates all obscurations, and the perfections of method, aspiration, strength and pristine wisdom are subsumed by the transcendent wisdom that is obtained subsequently to the transcendent path.üîΩTherefore, since it is the principal one, the perfection of wisdom is taught first.

original: des na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por pha rol tu phyin pa yin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes su las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni thabs dag smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro
analyzed: des na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por pha rol tu phyin pa yin la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rjes su las thob pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni thabs dag smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro
translated: The perfections of method, aspiration, strength and pristine wisdom are subsumed by the transcendent wisdom that is obtained subsequently to the transcendent path.

original: // des na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan nas /
analyzed: // des na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, since it is the principal one, the six perfections are taught first.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams nye bar bsdu par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to include the remaining perfections, he says, endowed with the perfection of the qualities of a Buddha, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the qualities of a Buddha is the perfection of means.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: The perfection of power is easy to understand.

original: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pha thams cad dam drug pa yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pha thams cad dam drug pa yin par gzung ngo //
translated: The perfection of higher knowledge refers to all the higher knowledges of a Buddha, or to the six.

original: yongs su shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of thorough cognition is the perfection of intuitive wisdom.

original: khyad par du gyur pa yin du zin kyang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa yin du zin kyang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even though it is a special state, how is the perfection of intuitive wisdom nonconceptual?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Because the gnosis that is attained subsequent to nonconceptual gnosis is the perfection of gnosis.

original: ye shes gang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcad nas rang nyid chos kyi longs spyod rjes su myong bar gyur pa dang gzhan dag yongs su smin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ye shes gang gis rtogs pa yongs su gcad nas rang nyid chos kyi longs spyod rjes su myong bar gyur pa dang gzhan dag yongs su smin par byed pa yin la /
translated: By means of that gnosis, having ascertained the realization, one experiences for oneself the enjoyment of the Dharma and brings others to full maturity.

original: de ltar gnyis po 'di dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis po 'di dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But these two are not present in nonconceptual gnosis.

original: de pas na ye @140b shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de pas na ye @140b shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of gnosis is not nonconceptual.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: The perfection of vows is as stated.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams so //
translated: The perfection of the knowledge of all modes is the stages of the Joyous, etc.

original: phan bar bzhed pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang btang snyoms dag go //
analyzed: phan bar bzhed pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dang btang snyoms dag go //
translated: The wish to benefit is joy and equanimity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'o //üîΩbla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'o // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called qualities of a Buddha are the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyis mtshams spyor ba spangs ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyis mtshams spyor ba spangs ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The so-called bliss of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is the result of the abandonment of the instincts of the afflictions and the instincts of the knowable.

original: chos thams cad la dbang phyug gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang phyug gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par spyod pa nyid do //
translated: The so-called perfection of sovereignty over all phenomena is the complete enjoyment of the meaning that goes in all ways.

original: zil gyis mi gnon pa dang zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa rnams kyis mi thub cing de rnams zil gyis gnon par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mi gnon pa dang zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa rnams kyis mi thub cing de rnams zil gyis gnon par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The so-called non-subjugation and subjugation is the non-conquerability by demons, tƒ´rthikas, and so on, and the subjugation of those.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called performance of miracles is the performance of the various kinds of miracles.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar mdzad pa sngon du 'gro ba can byang chub kyi sa bon bskyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis mgu bar mdzad pa sngon du 'gro ba can byang chub kyi sa bon bskyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of generating the seed of enlightenment is preceded by the pleasing of the disciples by the miraculous power.
